articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Leaves Dakar
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Leaves Dakar
 Pyongyang, April 6 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Monday left  Dakar after winding up his official goodwill visit to the Republic of Senegal.
					 Leaving together with him were Choe Chang Sik, minister of Public Health, Kim Hyong Jun, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Ri Myong San, vice-minister of Foreign Trade, and other suite members.
					
					 They were seen off by Sada Ndiaye, minister of Overseas Senegalese, and others concerned of Senegal and Ri Kyong Son, DPRK ambassador to Senegal.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Sends Message of Thanks to Senegalese President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Sends Message of Thanks to Senegalese President
Pyongyang, April 6 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of thanks to Abdoulaye Wade, president of Senegal, on Monday, leaving Dakar after wrapping up his visit to Senegal.
					In the message Kim Yong Nam expressed thanks to the president, government and people of Senegal for the warm welcome and cordial hospitality accorded to him and his party.
					
					I was very pleased to participate in the unveiling ceremony of the "Monument to Revival of Africa" held on the significant occasion of celebrating the 50th anniversary of the independence of Senegal and further deepen the friendship, in particular, the message noted.
					
					It referred to the fact that at a series of contacts both sides exchanged sincere and beneficial views on the issue of steadily and energetically boosting the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries and on matters of mutual concern.
					
					Noting with satisfaction that the visit marked a significant occasion in further deepening the understanding and friendship between the two peoples and boosting the bilateral relations, the message wished the friendly Senegalese people fresh progress and prosperity and the president of Senegal good health and greater success in his work.

articles.title: DPRK Ambassador to Switzerland Appointed
articles.content:
DPRK Ambassador to Switzerland Appointed
 Pyongyang, April 6 (KCNA) -- So Se Phyong was appointed as DPRK ambassador to Switzerland, according to a decree of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly.

articles.title: Floral Basket form Cambodian King
articles.content:
Floral Basket form Cambodian King
 Pyongyang, April 6 (KCNA) -- Norodom Sihamoni, king of Cambodia, sent a large floral basket to the DPRK embassy in Phnom Penh on the occasion of the Day of the Sun.
					 Under authorization of the king, the Royal Palace Ministry delegation of Cambodia led by Kong Sam Ol, deputy prime minister in charge of the Royal Palace, visited the DPRK embassy on April 1 to lay the basket before the portraits of President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il there.
					
					 The deputy prime minister wished the people of the DPRK greater successes in the efforts to build a great prosperous and powerful nation and achieve national reunification under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Floral Basket form Cambodian Great King
articles.content:
Floral Basket form Cambodian Great King
 Pyongyang, April 6 (KCNA) -- Norodom Sihanouk, great king of Cambodia, sent a large floral basket to the DPRK embassy in Phnom Penh on the occasion of the Day of the Sun.
					 Authorized by the great king, the Cambodian Royal Palace Ministry delegation led by Kong Sam Ol, deputy prime minister in charge of the Royal Palace, visited the DPRK embassy on April 1 to lay the floral basket before the portraits of President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il there.

articles.title: Day of Sun Stamps Issued
articles.content:
Day of Sun Stamps Issued
Pyongyang, April 6 (KCNA) -- Four individual stamps have been issued in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea to commemorate the Day of the Sun, the birth anniversary of President 
					Kim Il Sung (April 15).
					 Seen in the stamps are embroidery "Tiger", ceramic crafts "Manchurian Crane" and "Eagle" and a stuffed tortoise the President received from a head of state, prominent figures and people of other countries.
					
					 The stamps represent deep reverence of people across the world for the President, who made an immortal contribution to the Korean revolution and the cause of human independence.

articles.title: "Complete Collection of Kim Il Sung's Works" Published
articles.content:
"Complete Collection of Kim Il Sung's Works" Published
 Pyongyang, April 6 (KCNA) -- The Workers' Party of Korea Publishing House published Vol. 86 of "Complete Collection of Kim Il Sung's Works", a library of the immortal Juche idea systematically and comprehensively dealing with his famous works in a chronological order.
					 The book contains 34 works including historic conclusions, talks, speeches and congratulatory messages the President made from August to December, Juche 76 (1987).
					
					 The President in the works indicates ideas, strategic and tactical tasks and ways for bringing about a great surge in the socialist economic construction and achieving the independent and peaceful reunification of the country and global peace and security.
					
					 Clarified in the works are issues of developing the key industrial domains including metal, power and coal industries and easing the strain on railway transport and tasks and ways for thoroughly implementing the socialist rural theses and improving the people's standard of living.
					
					 The President underscored the need for the officials guiding economy to hold fast to the economic policy of the WPK and decisively improve the economic organization and guidance and management from a firm Juche-oriented stand in such works as "Conclusion Made at the Consultative Meeting of Senior Officials of the Administration Council" and "On Decisively Boosting the Economy in South Phyongan Province".
					
					 Expounded in various works including "On Channeling Great Efforts into the Development of Science and Technology" and "On Solving Heat Problem and Further Developing Science and Technology" are ideas of putting the nation's science and technology on a high level by focusing efforts on important scientific and technological fields and contributing to placing the national economy on a Juche-oriented, modern and scientific basis. 
					
					 The President re-clarified the strategic and tactical issues arising in achieving the independent and peaceful reunification of the country and ensuring peace and security in the Korean Peninsula and the rest of the world in such works as "Talk to a Delegation from the Japan Socialist Party" and "Progressive Youth of the World, Unite and Fight Vigorously against Imperialism".
					
					 The book also contains works clarifying the task facing the officials of the branches of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan to do well the work with the Korean workers in commerce in Japan and idea of boosting the economic and technical cooperation among developing countries and other issues.

articles.title: New Office Processing Program Developed
articles.content:
New Office Processing Program Developed
 Pyongyang, April 6 (KCNA) -- The Information Center of Pyongyang University of Printing has recently developed an office processing program.
					 It, improved in speed and safety, consists of word, table and database processors and the like and provides Korean and English spelling checkers.
					
					 It has many useful tools, as well as help.
					
					 The center had already brought out electronic publishing, business management and other programs to be highly appreciated in national software exhibitions.

articles.title: Komdok Mining Complex
articles.content:
Komdok Mining Complex
 Pyongyang, April 6 (KCNA) -- Located in South Hamgyong Province in the northern part of Korea is the Komdok Mining Complex, a leading nonferrous mineral producer of the country.
					 The Komdok area is abundant in several dozen kinds of mineral resources, including zincblende and galena.
					
					 Long time ago the Komdok valley was developed into a small-sized silver mine.
					
					 The Japanese imperialists, who monopolized the development right of the mine during their occupation of Korea, had plundered it of silver in the beginning but lead and zinc, too, in large quantities since the middle of the 1930s.
					
					 After the liberation of the country, the Komdok Mine began to make a considerable development while removing the backwardness, a leftover from the Japanese imperialists' colonial rule. 
					
					 During the Fatherland Liberation War a prospecting corps was formed for the area and a new dressing plant was constructed in the mine. After the war the mine had more large-scale pits built to expand the scope of production.
					
					 It, which turned into the Komdok Mining Complex later, replaced existing mining equipment with large and high-speed ones and diversified ore transport on a high level, laid long-distance belt conveyer transportation lines, built dressing plants Nos. 2 and 3 and pushed ahead with the development of a new mine.
					
					 Of late it has provided large-sized stopes, raised the ore transport capacity more than two times and built a large settling reservoir to fully dispose of residue from ore dressing plants.
					
					 The Komdok Mining Complex is now playing a big role in the building of a great, prosperous and powerful nation.

articles.title: US Psychological Warfare Flayed
articles.content:
US Psychological Warfare Flayed
 Pyongyang, April 6 (KCNA) -- The commanders of the U.S. forces in the Pacific and south Korea, at a recent hearing of the Appropriations Committee of the U.S. House of Representatives, claimed that the DPRK is "violating" resolutions of the UN Security Council and concentrating efforts on development of such weapons as missile.
					 In this regard Rodong Sinmun Tuesday in a signed commentary says:
					
					 The U.S. groundless accusation against the DPRK over what it called "missile threat" and "spread of banned arms" is part of the psychological warfare designed to attain its dirty aims. The reality shows that the U.S. sinister psychological warfare against the DPRK is getting evermore vicious while assuming a fresh aspect.
					
					 The development and deployment of missiles by the DPRK is for its self-defence from A to Z.
					
					 As for the source of the missile issue, it was spawned by the U.S. which has posed constant threat to the DPRK after introducing a large number of nukes and missiles to the southern part of the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 The rumor about "spread of banned arms", too, is a strategic propaganda invented by the U.S.
					
					 It is just the U.S. that should be censured worldwide for being an illegal spreader of weapons.
					
					 The U.S. is sadly mistaken if it calculates that it can prevent the DPRK from bolstering up its legitimate war deterrent by misleading the public opinion with such false rumors about "missile threat" and "spread of banned arms".
					
					 The said shameless sophism of the U.S. imperialists can never go down with anyone.

articles.title: US Urged to Take Lead in Eliminating N-Weapons
articles.content:
US Urged to Take Lead in Eliminating N-Weapons
 Pyongyang, April 6 (KCNA) -- Public voices demanding U.S. nuclear disarmament are growing stronger worldwide. This indicates that it has become a main focus of nuclear disarmament and a requirement of the times for the U.S. to eliminate nuclear weapons at present.
					 Minju Joson Tuesday observes this in a signed commentary.
					
					 The commentary goes on:
					
					 However, the U.S. is reacting to the demand of the international community for nuclear disarmament by persistently sticking to its nuclear policy.
					
					 As already known, the U.S. committed itself to work hard for the total elimination of nuclear weapons in the world, talking about "an initiative for building a world without nuclear weapons." 
					
					 If the commitment made by the U.S. before the world was true, there is no reason to fail to eliminate its nuclear weapons in Europe, the leftover of the Cold War era.
					
					 It is the nuclear strategy and policy initiative of the U.S. to monopolize nuclear weapons and hold supremacy in the field of strategic offensive weapons in a bid to establish an unchallenged domination over the world. In order to achieve this criminal aim the U.S. is posing constant nuclear threat to its rivals and the "potential enemies" after deploying its nuclear armed forces in the strategic strongholds of the world. 
					
					It is nobody's secret that the U.S. has seriously threatened the DPRK's right to existence and sovereignty since it deployed at least 1,000 nuclear weapons in south Korea.
					
					 All facts go to prove that the U.S. is chiefly to blame for having created the danger of a global nuclear war as it has not given up its wild ambition for dominating the world by nukes.
					
					 The disaster by nuclear weapons should not be allowed to repeat itself in the world and humankind can no longer be exposed to the threat of a nuclear war. 
					
					 The U.S., the world's biggest possessor of nuclear arsenal, should take the lead in eliminating nuclear weapons. It should eliminate nukes in south Korea, to begin with, and, furthermore, withdraw all its nuclear weapons from various parts of the world and dismantle them.
					
					 The U.S. should meet the demand of the world for the full settlement of the issue of nuclear disarmament.

articles.title: S. Korea's Anti-DPRK Smear Campaign Lambasted
articles.content:
S. Korea's Anti-DPRK Smear Campaign Lambasted
 Pyongyang, April 6 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet group "co-sponsored" the so-called "resolution" at the recent 13th UN Human Rights Council while siding with the U.S. and the Japanese reactionaries' criminal moves to slander and stifle the DPRK over the nonexistent "human rights issue". These moves come under fire by signed commentaries of leading newspapers Tuesday. 
					 Rodong Sinmun says that such action goes to prove that the conservative group has systematically escalated confrontation with the DPRK by abusing the signboard of "human rights" in collusion with foreign forces and it is growing reckless in such moves with each passing day. The news analyst goes on:
					
					 There exists no such issue as "human rights issue" in the DPRK nor can it exist there as it provides full legal and institutional guarantees to the independence of human being and the equal rights of the popular masses guided by the Juche idea. 
					
					 The south Korean puppet group rolled up its sleeves to support foreign forces' anti-DPRK "human rights" racket, a vivid manifestation of its deep-seated confrontational concept and bitterness toward fellow countrymen.  
					
					 The group has become frantic in staging absurd "human rights" smear campaign aimed at slandering fellow countrymen in collusion with foreign forces, not content with having blocked the inter-Korean dialogue and cooperation and escalated the anti-reunification oppression. This shows what a reckless level their moves to bedevil the inter-Korean relations and escalate the confrontation of system have reached.
					
					 It is as foolish and silly an act as running one's head against a hard wall to try to do harm to the dignified system of the DPRK.
					
					 Minju Joson says that the south Korean conservative group kicked up anti-DPRK "human rights" campaign even on the international arena while hardly settling its own problem, adding that this is a revelation of its black-hearted intention to bring the inter-Korean relations to a total collapse. It warns that all fellow countrymen will never pardon the confrontational maniacs but mercilessly punish them on behalf of the nation.

articles.title: Anniversary of Kim Il Sung's Work Observed
articles.content:
Anniversary of Kim Il Sung's Work Observed
 Pyongyang, April 6 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Tuesday dedicates a signed article to the 17th anniversary of the publication of President Kim Il Sung's work "10-Point Programme of the Great Unity of the Whole Nation for the Reunification of the Country" (April 6, 1993), a library on the great national unity.
					 The 10-point programme of the great unity of the whole nation advanced by the President is a great political programme as it imbues all the Koreans with a true patriotic idea that they should go united as a homogenous nation and pave the way for national reunification by their concerted efforts and clearly indicates an orientation and ways to accomplish the cause of the country's reunification by their united efforts, the article says, and goes on: 
					
					 General Secretary Kim Jong Il clearly formulated the 10-point programme of the great unity of the whole nation, the three principles of national reunification and the proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo clarified by the President as the three charters for national reunification which the Koreans should invariably hold fast to, no matter how the situation may change and no matter how the circumstances may alter in the future.
					
					 Kim Jong Il advanced the five-point policy of the great national unity, a successful embodiment of the President's idea of great national unity.
					
					 The five-point policy of the great national unity that clarifies all the issues of achieving the great national unity serves as a powerful engine for achieving the great unity. 
					
					 The June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration are the declarations of national independence and great national unity.
					
					 Clearly indicated by the inter-Korean joint declarations are the principle of building a driving force for reunification laid down in the 10-point programme of the great unity of the whole nation and tasks and ways set forth in the five-point policy of the great national unity.
					
					 A struggle for implementing the inter-Korean joint declaration precisely means a struggle for carrying out the 10-point programme of the great unity of the whole nation and the five-point policy of the great national unity.
					
					 In order to build a driving force for the country's reunification, it is necessary for the Koreans to pool their efforts, first of all, the article notes, adding that the great unity of the whole nation is the main factor of advancing the cause of Korea's reunification.

articles.title: Punishment of Pro-Japanese Treacherous Forces Demanded
articles.content:
Punishment of Pro-Japanese Treacherous Forces Demanded
 Pyongyang, April 6 (KCNA) -- The preparatory commission for the Students Committee of the Youth and Students Solidarity for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration in south Korea issued a statement on April 1, demanding the punishment of the pro-Japanese treacherous forces.
					 Referring to the fact that the Japanese authorities passed the screening of textbooks for primary schools on which Tok Islets are marked as part of Japan's territory, the statement charged that Japan is getting hell-bent on the scheme to grab Tok Islets, persistently watching for a chance to stage a comeback to Korea though it made the history of crimes by violating the sovereignty of the Korean nation.
					
					 The present "government" of south Korea has not yet shown any reaction to such behavior of Japan, advocating "pragmatic diplomacy" but, on the contrary, is taking a humiliating attitude, the statement pointed out.
					
					 Urging the resignation of the "government" speaking for the interests of Japan, it declared that a more vigorous struggle would be waged to punish the pro-Japanese regime.

articles.title: S. Korean Dictatorial Regime's Fascist Suppression Flailed
articles.content:
S. Korean Dictatorial Regime's Fascist Suppression Flailed
 Pyongyang, April 6 (KCNA) -- The Solidarity for Implementing the South-North Joint Declaration in south Korea issued a statement on April 1 to denounce the dictatorial regime for its fascist suppression.
					 That day the police authorities confiscated and searched the house and office of the representative of "Chongchun" Internet broadcasting service under the solidarity on the charge of the violation of the "National Security Law", the statement said.
					
					 "Chongchun" is enjoying support from the forces for progressive reform, it noted, adding that through the crackdown the conservative ruling forces seek to eliminate those forces hostile to them in the "election to the local self-governing bodies".
					
					 The conservative media branding the activities of the solidarity as ones of "benefiting the enemy" and the security authorities resorting to the forcible search are all the same clans, the statement held.
					
					 We will never tolerate the ceaseless suppression of the solidarity, it said, stressing that we will wage a more dynamic struggle to force the dictatorial regime keen on the fascist suppression to step down.

articles.title: Japan's Discrimination against Korean Schools Protested
articles.content:
Japan's Discrimination against Korean Schools Protested
 Pyongyang, April 6 (KCNA) -- Protests of Koreans in Japan and Japanese citizens are going on everyday in different parts of Japan to denounce the Japanese authorities for their discrimination against the Korean schools.
					 "March 28 rally to reject national discrimination and xenophobia and not to pardon attack on Korean schools!" was held in Kyoto on March 28. It was co-sponsored by Japanese civic organizations including the "Kyoto City Society for Supporting Korean Schools".
					
					 Present there were at least 900 Koreans in Japan and Japanese citizens.
					
					 At the rally speakers recalled the unreasonable behavior of the Japanese authorities to exclude Korean schools from the tuition-free program for senior high schools. They called upon all people to pool their efforts to put an end to discrimination in the Japanese society.
					
					 At the end of the rally its participants staged a demonstration march.
					
					 An emergency rally to denounce the discrimination against the Korean schools was held in Kobe on March 29 under the co-sponsorship of 23 organizations including the Hyogo Prefectural Citizens' Society for Japan-DPRK Friendship. At the rally speakers called upon men and women of all ages to turn out in the drive to settle the issue of supporting the Korean schools.
					
					 The rally adopted an appeal demanding the Japanese government cancel its policy of discrimination against the Korean schools.
					
					 Meanwhile, members of City Assembly in the Kennan area of Ibaraki Prefecture visited the Ministry of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology on March 31 and conveyed to it a written request addressed to the minister.

articles.title: Colombia-Korea Association Issues Bulletin
articles.content:
Colombia-Korea Association Issues Bulletin
 Pyongyang, April 6 (KCNA) -- The Colombia-Korea Association of Friendship and Culture issued a bulletin on Mar. 30 on the occasions of the 17th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's election as chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and the 78th anniversary of the foundation of the heroic Korean People's Army.
					 The bulletin noted in an article titled "NDC Chairman Kim Jong Il and the KPA" that Kim Jong Il has developed the KPA into an army strong in ideology and faith, firmly armed with the spirit of devotedly defending the leader.
					
					 The KPA led by him is sure to emerge victorious--this is the main core of the ideological and moral traits of the KPA and herein lies its invincible might, it said, adding:
					
					 Under his wise leadership the KPA has grown to be a strong army perfect not only in politico-ideological aspect but also in military technological terms and secured even powerful war deterrent lest any imperialist formidable enemy dare provoke.
					
					The KPA will always win victory after victory as an invincible army under the leadership of
						 Kim Jong Il, the bulletin stressed.

articles.title: Peru's Publishing House Publishes Kim Il Sung's Works
articles.content:
Peru's Publishing House Publishes Kim Il Sung's Works
 Pyongyang, April 6 (KCNA) -- The Grafica A. J. Hermanos Publishing House of Peru brought out the collection of President Kim Il Sung's works "On the Three Principles of National Reunification" on Mar. 29.

articles.title: Conversaciones entre Kim Yong Nam y Abdoulaye Wade
articles.content:
Conversaciones entre Kim Yong Nam y Abdoulaye Wade
Pyongyang, 6 de abril (ATCC) -- Tuvieron lugar el dia 4 en el palacio presidencial las conversaciones entre Kim Yong Nam, presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Abdoulaye Wade, presidente de la Republica del Senegal.
					En la ocasion Abdoulaye expreso su satisfaccion de que fue erguido magnificamente el "Monumento a la Restauracion de Africa" por los talentosos tecnicos coreanos.
					
					Cada pais tiene la soberania en la opcion de su linea, senalo y prosiguio que apoyaba la politica independiente de Corea.
					
					En la ocasion ambas partes intercambiaron sus opiniones sobre el problema de consolidar los lazos de amistad con la excelente tradicion entre los dos paises y de ampliar y desarrollar las relaciones bilaterales y otros asuntos de interes comun.
					
					Asistieron alli el vicecanciller coreano Kim Hyong Jun, el embajador coreano en este pais africano Ri Kyong Son, el ministro del Estado y de Relaciones Exteriores Becaye Diop, el asesor diplomatico del presidente Oumar D. Ba., y el asesor especial del presidente Papa Mohamed Camara.
					
					Las conversaciones transcurrieron en un ambiente amistoso.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il recibe maxima orden del Senegal
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il recibe maxima orden del Senegal
Pyongyang, 6 de abril (ATCC) -- El Dirigente   Kim Jong Il recibio la maxima orden del Senegal, Gran Cruz Nacional, que le dirigiera Abdoulaye Wade, presidente de este pais africano.
					 El presidente senegales la entrego el dia 4 al presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, de visita oficial y de amistad al Senegal.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam participa en acto por 50o aniversario de independencia
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam participa en acto por 50o  aniversario de independencia
Pyongyang, 6 de abril (ATCC) -- Kim Yong Nam, presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, de visita oficial y de amistad a la Republica del Senegal, participo el dia 4 en el acto por el 50o aniversario de la independencia de este pais africano.
					Ese dia tuvieron lugar en Dakar el desfile militar y la manifestacion multitudinaria del ejercito y el pueblo del Senegal.
					
					Los presenciaron el presidente senegales Abdoulaye Wade, las personalidades de diversos estratos, los comandantes del Ejercito, del Senegal, decenas de miles de ciudadanos de Dakar, los jefes de Estado y de gobierno y las delegaciones de alto rango de los paises africanos, los representantes de varias organizaciones internacionales y regionales, los representantes diplomaticos de diferentes paises y los representantes de las organizaciones internacionales acreditados en ese pais.

articles.title: Parte de Dakar Kim Yong Nam
articles.content:
Parte de Dakar Kim Yong Nam
Pyongyang, 6 de abril (ATCC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, partio el dia 5 de Dakar tras realizar una visita oficial y de amistad a la Republica del Senegal.
					Le acompanaron el ministro de Salud Publica Choe Chang Sik, el vicecanciller Kim Hyong Jun, el viceministro de Comercio Exterior Ri Myong San y otros acompanantes.
					
					Kim y su comitiva fueron despedidos por Sada Ndiaye, ministro senegales de Compatriotas Ultramarinas, y otros interesados, asi como por Ri Kyong Son, embajador coreano en este pais africano.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam agradece a Abdoulaye Wade
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam agradece a Abdoulaye Wade
Pyongyang, 6 de abril (ATCC) -- Kim Yong Nam, presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, envio el dia 5 un telegrama de agradecimiento al presidente de la Republica del Senegal, Abdoulaye Wade saliendo de Dakar tras realizar la visita oficial y de amistad a este pais africano.
					Kim, en su telegrama, expreso su gran agradecimiento al presidente, el gobierno y el pueblo del Senegal por haberles dado una calurosa bienvenida y  hospitalidad cordial.
					
					Sobre todo, indico que pensaba deleitosamente profundizar mas el sentimiento de amistad al participar en la ceremonia de descubrimiento del "Monumento a la Restauracion de Africa" efectuada en la ocasion significativa para celebrar el 50o aniversario de la independencia del Senegal. 
					
					Prosiguio que en los contactos de varias veces efectuados entre ambas partes intercambiaron las opiniones sinceras y utiles sobre el problema de fortalecer y desarrollar continua y dinamicamente las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion y otros asuntos de interes mutuo.
					
					Tambien expreso su satisfaccion de que su visita de esta vez sirvio de un motivo significativo para profundizar mas la comprension y la fraternidad entre ambos pueblos y promover aun mas el desarrollo de las relaciones bilaterales.
					
					Por ultimo, Kim formulo votos por un nuevo progreso y la prosperidad del amistoso pueblo senegales y la salud de su homologo y los mayores exitos de su trabajo.

articles.title: Nombrado nuevo embajador coreano en Suiza
articles.content:
Nombrado nuevo embajador coreano en Suiza
Pyongyang, 6 de abril (ATCC) -- Segun un decreto del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, So Se Phyong fue designado como embajador extraordinario y plenipotenciario de la RPDC a acreditarse en la Confederacion Suiza.

articles.title: Periodicos denuncian campana de "DDHH" anti-RPDC
articles.content:
Periodicos denuncian campana de "DDHH" anti-RPDC
Pyongyang, 6 de abril (ATCC) -- En la 13a reunion del Consejo de DDHH de la ONU, recien efectuada,  los titeres surcoreanos "propusieron en comun una resolucion" adhiriendose a las maniobras criminales de Estados Unidos y los reaccionarios japoneses encaminadas a denigrar y aplastar a la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea bajo el pretexto del supuesto "problema de DDHH".
					Los periodicos centrales insertaron en sus ediciones de este martes los comentarios individuales para denunciar tales maniobras de los titeres surcoreanos. 
					
					El diario Rodong Sinmun senala que se tornan cada dia mas siniestras e imprudentes de manera sistematica bajo la cooperacion con las fuerzas extranjeras las maniobras conflictivas anti-RPDC de la banda de conservadores surcoreanos so pretexto de "DDHH". 
					
					En la RPDC donde se aseguran firmemente en lo legitimo e institucional la independencia del ser humano y los derechos imparciales de las masas populares a base de la idea Juche, no existe ni puede surgir el "problema de DDHH".
					
					Los titeres surcoreanos aplauden y se adhieren activamente a la campana de "DDHH" anti-RPDC de las fuerzas extranjeras, lo que evidencia su concepcion de confrontacion arraigada y su hostilidad a los connacionales. 
					
					No satisfechos de la interrupcion del dialogo y la cooperacion Norte-Sur y de la represion anti-reunificacion, ellos intensifican cada dia mas la campana de "DDHH" contra los connacionales cooperando con las fuerzas extranjeras. Esto muestra que llegan a la etapa tan imprudente tales maniobras tendentes a llevar a la ruptura las relaciones Norte-Sur y enfrentarse con el sistema de la RPDC. 
					
					Denigrar el prestigioso sistema de la RPDC es un acto igual a arar en el mar. 
					
					El rotativo Minju Joson, a su vez, critica que la campana de "DDHH" anti-RPDC, que libra la banda de conservadores surcoreanos en la palestra internacional sin purgar sus culpas, es la revelacion de la malsana intencion de romper por completo las relaciones Norte-Sur, y advierte que todos los coreanos nunca perdonaran a los maniacos de confrontacion sino los castigaran severamente a nombre de la nacion.
